page.title: 11Rt.Hon.Boscawen's role as MP
page.content: The Rt. Hon. Boscawen's{role as Whip.} His specific duty is to report parliamentary business to the Queen. There are 14 Whips in the Government, who try to keep some order in Parliament. On matters of extreme importance, all M.P.s must be present. The Whips have control over certain areas : the Rt. Hon. Boscawen's area is the{South_West.}He makes sure that all 37 M.P.s from that area are present in Parliament to vote on the matter in hand.In some cases 'bisques' are allowed.This is when one M.P. for the motion pairs off with one against the motion,so that the final majority is not affected.To deal with his {consistuency business}the Rt. Hon. Boscawen holds 'surgeries'. These are held all around his constituency,so that every constituent has a chance to discuss problems with him.
